intro: Spiradiclis oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spiradiclis, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to oblanceolate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Spiradiclis oblanceolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
